error.signature: Error response from daemon: cannot stop container: permission denied

verdict.summary: Docker cannot stop a container, often due to a zombie process or AppArmor/SELinux restriction.

dead_ends.action: Using kill -9 on the container PID from the host
dead_ends.why_fails: May leave Docker's state inconsistent; container appears running
Disruptive to all running containers and services

workarounds.action: Try docker kill <container> for a SIGKILL instead of SIGTERM
workarounds.how: docker stop sends SIGTERM; docker kill sends SIGKILL

workarounds.action: Check AppArmor/SELinux: dmesg | grep -i deny for policy blocks
workarounds.how: SELinux or AppArmor may prevent container signal delivery
